Summary of evidence: A significant proportion of catheter insertions in hospitalised patients were considered unnecessary.
Education programs can reduce the incidence of catheter-related urethral injury.
Larger catheter size was associated with a greater risk of navicular fossa strictures.
Non-coated latex catheters are associated with a greater degree of urethritis and possibly a greater   risk of urethral strictures than non-latex catheters or coated latex catheters.
